FuncDef:
The radius-server nas-port-id lns include command configures the format of the NAS-Port-Id attribute sent by the L2TP LNS to the RADIUS server.
The undo radius-server nas-port-id lns command deletes the configured format of the NAS-Port-Id attribute sent by the L2TP LNS to the RADIUS server.
By default, the LNS or a non-LNS device retains the format of the NAS-Port-Id attribute to be sent to the RADIUS server.
CLIs: radius-server nas-port-id lns include [ string <string> | ip <delimiter> ] { local-tunnel-ip [ <delimiter> ] | peer-tunnel-ip [ <delimiter> ] | local-tunnel-id [ <delimiter> ] | peer-tunnel-id [ <delimiter> ] | local-session-id [ <delimiter> ] peer-session-id [ <delimiter> ] | call-serial-number [ <delimiter> ] } *

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a user-defined character string.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 characters.

Indicates a delimiter.
The value is b, *, -, \, #, $, @, &, :.

Indicates the source IP address of the local tunnel.
-

Indicates the IP address of the remote tunnel.
-

Examples: [~HUAWEI-radius-test1] radius-server nas-port-id lns include ip $ local-tunnel-id - local-session-id - local-tunnel-ip $
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If the RADIUS server has special requirements on the format of the NAS-Port-Id attribute, run the radius-server nas-port-id lns or radius-server nas-port-id command to configure the format of the NAS-Port-Id attribute as required.
Configuration Impact
If the radius-server nas-port-id lns or radius-server nas-port-id command is run more than once in the same view, the latest configuration overrides the previous one. After the radius-server nas-port-id lns or radius-server nas-port-id command is run, the NAS-Port-Id attribute is sent to the RADIUS server in the configured format.
